info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:35PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Washington, northeastern Rensselaer, western Bennington and west central Windham Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greenwich, or 11 miles northeast of Mechanicville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Salem, Manchester, Shaftsbury, Cambridge, Greenwich, Manchester Center, Hoosick, Lee, White Creek, Easton, North Bennington, Schuylerville, Sunderland, Woodford, Sandgate, Old Bennington and Glastenbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
